channel.title: Whats this?

item.title: Whats this?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:12, topic:431362”][quote author=t4 link=topic=534040.msg3905101#msg3905101 date=1328148087]

are those local variables called anywhere else in that method? if not, they’re uselss.

Yeah thats what I’m thinking, but I’m a bit afraid to remove them,
even I don’t get errors when removing the line,
I’m afraid to get a null when trying to login o.o Ive had it many times in my development lol

…

use an IDE or any sort of syntax highlighting environment.
[/quote]

I am[/quote]
then your environment should warn you if it’s an unused variable… tbh, i think the compiler will get rid of it anyway during optimization.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats this?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:9, topic:431362”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=534040.msg3904875#msg3904875 date=1328139056]

are those local variables called anywhere else in that method? if not, they’re uselss.

Yeah thats what I’m thinking, but I’m a bit afraid to remove them,
even I don’t get errors when removing the line,
I’m afraid to get a null when trying to login o.o Ive had it many times in my development lol

make a backup copy, then remove the _tmp. if it does nothing, Great. if it crashes and gives you a BSOD, you might wanna put the backup file in its place
[/quote]

It’s not goign to crash by removing it lol,
but the function of the code could be harmed[/quote]

which is why he should make a back-up. and i was obv kidding about the crash, one simple compile error wont give ur computer a BSOD, lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats this?
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:

are those local variables called anywhere else in that method? if not, they’re uselss.

even I don’t get errors when removing the line,
I’m afraid to get a null when trying to login o.o Ive had it many times in my development lol
[/quote]

make a backup copy, then remove the _tmp. if it does nothing, Great. if it crashes and gives you a BSOD, you might wanna put the backup file in its place :)[/quote]

It’s not goign to crash by removing it lol,
but the function of the code could be harmed

item.title: Whats this?

even I don’t get errors when removing the line,
I’m afraid to get a null when trying to login o.o Ive had it many times in my development lol[/quote]

make a backup copy, then remove the _tmp. if it does nothing, Great. if it crashes and gives you a BSOD, you might wanna put the backup file in its place

item.title: Whats this?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:3, topic:431362”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=534040.msg3904214#msg3904214 date=1328059250]
GUESS: It’s making new movements of npcs and players?
[/quote]

I’m talking about the _tmp since it’s indicated as unnused,[/quote]

I know, temp as in temporary movement the = and so on are changing it.

Like I breathe, these _tmps are each action I did while breathing.

Again, this is MY guess (especially remember MY guess as they are sometimes wrong).

item.title: Whats this?
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Where is that …tmp for?
I see it everywhere, but it’s unused everywhere to.
Where is it for o.o

PlayerHandler _tmp1 = server.playerHandler; i = PlayerHandler.players[npcs[NPCID].StartKilling].absX; PlayerHandler _tmp2 = server.playerHandler; j = PlayerHandler.players[npcs[NPCID].StartKilling].absY; PlayerHandler _tmp3 = server.playerHandler;

Read full topic
